intro: Urostemon kirkii var. angustior, commonly known as the narrow-leaved urostemon, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, while its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive two-lipped structure. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in association with other woodland flora.
